Package pieces

package pieces
This package holds all the different types of pieces that are used in a game of chess, specifically: King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Pawn, and Rook. It bases these pieces on an abstract class Piece, which holds the general functionality of the specific pieces while the subclasses implement the piece specific traits, such as determining if a piece's movement to a specific coordinate is valid or not.
Author:
Julius Ramirez
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    Bishop
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains Bishop specific implementations of the methods standardMove(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
    King
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains King specific implementations of the methods standardMove(),updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
    Knight
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains Knight specific implementations of the methods standardMove(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
    Pawn
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains Pawn specific implementations of the methods validMove(), standardMove(), updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
    Piece
    This abstract class is responsible for outlining general Piece functionality.
    Queen
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains Queen specific implementations of the methods validMove(), standardMove(), setLocation() updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
    Rook
    A subclass of Piece, this class contains Rook specific implementations of the methods standardMove(),updateLocation(), hasNoCollisions(), and generateMoves().
